alert.note: Alert for Redwood (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 10:33PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Redwood, Brown, northwestern Watonwan and northwestern Nicollet Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1033 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Morgan, or 16 miles southeast of Redwood Falls, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Sleepy Eye around 1050 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include New Ulm. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 14 between mile markers 53 and 101. U.S. Highway 71 between mile markers 52 and 75. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for south central, central and southwestern Minnesota.
